alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:51PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace and northeastern Greeley Counties through 615 PM MDT/715 PM CDT/... At 551 PM MDT/651 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Wallace, or 10 miles southeast of Sharon Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace and northeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT/900 PM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
